nodes.bodyText:
You should also assert the ground condition, that the charge was 0 before executing the command.
This way we can be certain that this did actually update.
Also you should pick a more unique id to prevent overlaps with future or existing unit tests, "SF_CHARGE_TEST_ITEM" for example.

This test alone is pretty good and sufficient.
In theory you could add more tests to achieve better coverage but I think this is enough
You could be more specific here *"to the maximum value as defined by Rechargeable#getMax..."
No need to mark this as final here, especially not in a Unit Test.
"RechargeableItem" was probably a more appropriate class name, my previous comment was only in regard to the id, not the class name.
